name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pok√©mon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

strengths: Whirlpool discards opponent's energy - built-in disruption
Water Gun scales with extra energy (up to 50 damage)
Benefits from Rain Dance energy acceleration
synergies: Blastoise - Rain Dance powers up Water Gun
Energy Removal - Combined with Whirlpool for energy denial
counters: Venusaur - Grass type with good HP

competitiveHistory: Poliwrath was occasionally used in Rain Dance decks as an alternative attacker to the main threats. Whirlpool's built-in energy removal provided utility, and Water Gun benefited from Rain Dance's energy acceleration.

rulings.ruling: Water Gun's bonus damage is calculated based on Water Energy attached beyond the 2 needed to pay for the attack.
The +20 damage cap on Water Gun means maximum damage is 50.
For Whirlpool, the attacking player chooses which Energy card to discard from the Defending Pokemon.
If the Defending Pokemon has no Energy cards attached, Whirlpool still does its damage but has no discard effect.
